clinical_study.brief_title: Action Seniors! Exercise to Prevent Falls
clinical_study.official_title: "Action Seniors!: A 12 Month Randomized Controlled Trial of a Home Based Strength and Balance Retraining Program in Reducing Falls.

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be a randomized controlled trial to determine the efficacy of the Otago Exercise Program (OEP) on falls among seniors with a history of falls.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 344 community-dwelling adults aged 70 years and older who are referred to a falls clinic secondary to seeking medical attention due to a fall will be randomized to either the 12-month OEP group or usual care. There will be three measurement sessions: baseline, 6 months, and 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary outcomes of interest include: 1) physiological falls risk; 2) mobility; 3) cognitive function; and 4) economic evaluation.

arm_group.description: OEP (Otago Exercise Program; home-based balance and strength retraining program)

intervention.intervention_name: Home-based balance and strength retraining exercise program.
intervention.description: A 12-month home-based balance and strength restraining program delivered by a physical therapist
Usual care as prescribed by geriatrician.
